intro: Xylophragma myrianthum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and attractive, velvety leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white. It is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care. Xylophragma myrianthum thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
